Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Duke University a lot; even though I'm a freshman, the overall balance of the school is really good. Everyone here is also very work-hard play-hard, so it's definitely something that is helpful to learn along the way. The students here are extremely smart, but humble as well, so it's not a super competitive/stressful environment; rather, you can pursue what you're interested in.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I would like the living diversity. The students they are so very happy at the moment picture. They are so beautiful and amazing places. But I don't know the weather. Mostly if the weather conditions is I think it is good. I am afraid of Avery cold freezy season. Always am concerned about the climate and the food we are eating. Because may not be suitable with my condition. I am not sure but I love normal weather. Even though about the food l like ballance food with everything's. Maybe some thing to adapt to some things you don't know before that's not easier to adapt. With people also maybe easier.
You know mostly l am talking about the food why I don't know. What is my aim perpose is this for food or my education dream. Yes my graduation dream but by the way l like to mention regarding the food we are eating. Some tames if we are concentrated our delicious foods and spices do think is this harmful to our body. I mean the same like toxins to our healthy. Like high sodium and sugar too.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great architecture and academics. There is a lot of school spirit and support from faculty, but safety and instruction could be improved.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Duke University has been an incredible place to grow academically, personally, and professionally. The rigorous academics, coupled with access to world-class faculty, have pushed me to think critically and explore areas of study I never imagined I would pursue. The campus is stunning, and the vibrant community creates an environment that fosters collaboration and innovation.

One of the things I truly appreciate about Duke is its interdisciplinary focus. Whether through specialized courses, research opportunities, or extracurricular activities, students are encouraged to break traditional academic boundaries. Organizations like the Innovation and Entrepreneurship Initiative or programs like Bass Connections allow for hands-on experiences that prepare you for real-world challenges.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke is a haven for woke professors and staff . The university was embarrassed nationally by the Group of 88 two decades ago and has never recovered. That rush to judgment by those professors before the Facts were know, highlights the bigotry and narrow mindedness of some of Dukes staff then and now . Attempting to ruin students lives by a mob of PHD bullies was criminal.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great school but not the best surroundings. Lots of parties and seems like kids are not getting work done most of the time. But just find you right people
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a freshman college was a huge change that I was unprepared for. Even so, Duke has so many outlets for help or guidance it is almost impossible to fail here. There are tutors available almost at your convenience, professors are always willing to help, and communities are ready to take you into their loving arms. I love the campus and the community. I found people I know I can depend on when times get tough and that's another line of support I've solidified in the past few months. I can't even think of a major complaint I would have towards this school, Duke is not perfect but it's accommodating and a lovely experience that I can't wait to see more of. I still get homesick and worry about my future, but I honestly feel Duke will ensure I achieve whatever dream I strive for. If Duke has what you're looking for, I wouldn't hesitate to give it a chance.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really enjoyed attending Duke University. The academics are challenging and stellar and the students are ambitious yet friendly. Professors are, for the most part, helpful and encouraging but you need to find the right ones, as there are a handful that are stuck in their ways and have biased political or social agendas, which spills over into how they evaluate students academically. Academic isolationism between departments is a challenge that impedes innovation, but I appreciate that Duke has interdisciplinary initiatives to break down these walls. Overall a fantastic school with great name brand and prowess, but one that can think more about true social progress and provide more holistic support to students' development, and not just their careers.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Completing my program mostly online but professors, peers, and coursework are fantastic. I'd like betteer funding opportunities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a great experience here! The campus is stunning, the professors are top-notch, and the academic rigor is unmatched.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is perfect for many majors. I went there for Marine Biology though. It has the best professors to.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: At Duke, I was really able to excel and become a better students. The college itself really helped me get the push I needed with things like networking and overall opportunities as an engineering student and I could not be happier with where I am. The student life is amazing and there is just so much that makes Duke really a star college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: As an accelerated nursing student at Duke's School of Nursing, I have had the most supportive staff and students. They communicate effectively via email and easily accessible on the phone for any needs and questions. They have made the matriculation process very chunked in a way that I am not overwhelmed. As a new student, I do not really have much experience yet to see any changes that I would suggest.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have had an excellent experience at Duke thus far and am sad to see graduation looming! The campus spirit and academics are outstanding.  I would like to see improvement in the social experience. Since Greek life has been removed from campus, parties are now less safe as they are held in remote fields far away from campus often without cellular service.  Bringing the fraternities and sororities back on campus would create a safer social environment as they will continue to stay alive, whether on or off campus. When the administration attempts to break up parties and remove them from campus, it only serves to make them more exclusive, therefore creating a hierarchical social pyramid where many students feel excluded.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke university has been an amazing experience in regards to exposure to new people, diverse thought, and unique experiences. However, the school falls short in a lack of organization for students and an overwhelming first week for freshman students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke was a great school to attend! It was a rigorous academic experience that also allowed for students to explore themselves and the local community! Please apply here if you want to enjoy independent life and creating new experiences with various people, communities, and cultures!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Besides the rigorous academics, Duke is very diverse and connected. There is never an event going on. There are so many things for students to do. The food is great! But yes, eventually you will get tired of it. And it's fun exploring Durham with your friends.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke is a great community! While classes were difficult, challenged us to think critically, and were competitive by nature, I believe Duke students worked hard to help each other learn and succeed. Being in a small town like Durham and living on campus for 3 years, Duke fosters a strong sense of community unique to other universities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Excellent academics, social atmosphere, food, and sports. Con includes extremely expensive, not just looking at tuition, but for other smaller fees like laundry, which is paid out of pocket. Social scene highly revolves around greek life and selective living groups, which is catered towards the rich.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke University is an incredible university filled with vast challenges and opportunities for students passionate about various different fields.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I go to Duke Kunshan, which is a Duke partnership school in China. The best part about going to DKU is being able to experience other cultures; not only Chinese culture but that of my classmates and people I've become close friends with.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The academics are as expected, challenging yet rewarding. The professors are well educated and helpful for the most part, and you will learn a lot. Hard work and exploration is encouraged. The social scene can be a bit messy, especially for those who are not wealthy. Clubs are selective and you have to rush to join them. Greek life is not affiliated with the school, but still quite relevant and beyond clicky. A lot of students knew eachother prior to Duke or their parents did, so that results in exclusion.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I graduated from Duke University 2 days ago with a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology and a Global Health Minor. I lived on campus at Duke for all 4 years, and held an on-campus job (or 2 or 3) for three out of the four years I attended the University. I loved the people I met and who became my chosen family. I met my partner there who I plan to marry one day. The academics are rigorous but I learned so much, and all the psychology professors truly care about their students growth and well-being.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke is an amazing place to go to college! I have loved every minute here as CS major -- the classes are challenging, professors are engaging and available, the campus is beautiful, and the people are incredibly smart and down-to-earth. I chose Duke over some other great schools and I can't recommend it enough!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Overall I highly recommend Duke University as an Undergraduate university because the sense of community is unbeatable and the professors are willing and able to help their students prosper. The athletics and school pride is shown often and proves to create community and garner relationships for a lifetime.

One thing I would like to change about Duke University is the dorm situation. I think some dorms need to be remodeled. While many dorms are in the process of being remodeled and upgraded, it seems the school is not focused on making living situations better for all dorms, so I think one main place of improvement is living situations.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke has everything I could ever ask for. It has a beautiful campus, diversity, lots of extracurriculars and organizations available to join, great housing, delicious food, amazing student life especially through school spirit about sports, and more.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I found Duke to be the rare combination of world-class academics, top tier athletics / school spirit and fun parties. I do not think there is another school in the world that encompasses all three the way Duke does. Add in a gorgeous campus, wonderful North Carolina weather and some of the best dining facilities on a college campus in the country. 

Most importantly, I met my best friends for life at Duke. Attending Duke was the best decision I have ever made
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great if you are in greek life, can be limiting without. The housing is terrible and admin does not care about you. But the athletics and school culture and unbeatable.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
My experience at Duke University was nothing short of exceptional. The university's commitment to academic excellence made it a truly enriching environment to be a part of

Academic Rigor: Duke's rigorous academic programs challenged me to think critically and develop a deep understanding of my field of study.

World-Class Faculty: The faculty members at Duke are experts in their respective fields, and their passion for teaching and research was evident in every class and interaction.

Overall, my experience at Duke University was incredibly rewarding, and I am grateful for the opportunities it provided me to grow academically, personally, and professionally.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am a Master of Divinity Student. I do not interact much with Duke Undergraduates or campus life but the Div school has some good professors and some heretical ones
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a freshman at Duke University, I had a challenging first semester. My courseload was overwhelming and it was difficult to navigate and adapt to my new classes. Duke University did provide many resources such as tutoring, academic resources, as well as office hours with my professors. The environment at Duke is very beneficial because all students, professors, and staff are there to help you. I was always surrounded by someone I could talk to and get help from. I ended my semester much better than it started and look forward to achieving more.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Duke has had its ups and downs. On one hand it is quality education but the people at the school are rude.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It has been great, with good friends and amazing professors. There is a work-hard play play-hard atmosphere that constantly uplifts but also demands much but there are ways to carve out time for relaxation to get the most out of Duke.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
So far my experience has been very good.  The class sizes that I have had so far has been ideal for me.  Many of my professors have provided me with help when needed.  They have responded quickly to my emails and given me resources when needed.  
Another positive aspect of my experience has been the school spirit.  Everyone seems to take pride in the school.  There always many activities especially sporting events that bring the campus together.  It makes you feel like you are a part of the campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Its an amazing school. Great collaborative culture, amazing people. I love campus, the food, the community and all of it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the activities that are always listed on the Duke Groups app and provide a range of free food options. There is always programming that keep students engaged beyond classes. The classes are difficult but there are flexible options from office hours to math help room. The only thing that could be improved is the bus commute on the C1, where there seems to be a shortage of buses during the busiest transition times.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved my time at Duke. My professors were excellent and I enjoyed almost all of them. The community is largely supportive, and I made some amazing friends. During my time there, I saw support for first generation students grow, which was hugely important for my experience. The resources are there for students, they just needed to be more accessible, and the university continues to work on that. Of course there is more to be done, but overall I’m very happy with my experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Fantastic experience. Intellectually stimulating environment, and the professors really care about the students. Like any college, you have to be proactive about finding where you fit. Unlike one other review that complained about poor sports and racism (maybe a UNC student planting a poor review), I experienced and witnessed none of that. Beautiful campus, great food, and lots of opportunities for growth offered here. Durham has been growing and offers many great restaurant and shopping options.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Incredible university, definitely the best in the United States. While the academics are top notch, what makes this school so must better than the rest is sports. Everyone is so connected through basketball and the relatively small population helps everyone feel like a family.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great food, great professors but TAs are not as helpful. Lots of support in all academic and personal areas.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke is honestly amazing overall. Our campus is gorgeous, our professors are so intelligent, accomplished, and kind, our sports culture is unmatched, our academics are rigorous, but our atmosphere is nothing but collaborative. We're a prestigious school from the outside, but at Duke everyone is incredibly kind, open to new ideas, and very down-to-earth. The courses are certainly challenging, but there are so many resources for student wellness and health. Plus, social life here makes all the studying worth it. Both on campus and with off-campus disaffiliated greek life, the party scene is pretty good and always lots of fun. Overall, I love this school and honestly think it is the best college in America.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoyed the academic rigor quite a bit - I met a great group of friends and really liked North Carolina. However, Durham was not super safe, and the school was very Greek focused for an academically rigorous institution. It was hard to be socially accepted if you were not in a fraternity.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke offers me an enriching and transformative experience. What stands out to me the most is the invaluable network and the exceptional people I've encountered here. The community at Duke is filled with goal-oriented, friendly, and intelligent individuals, all of whom have inspired and motivated me to strive for excellence. Moreover, Duke's commitment to providing outstanding academic resources has been a game-changer for me. I'm especially thankful for the innovative and entrepreneurship resources, as they have open my career path to startups. Lastly, the buildings and nature are beautiful!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke is an incredible school that combines academic rigour and a social place with many extracurricular opportunities. The campus is beautiful and easy to navigate, and the food is also correctly rated as one of the best in the nation. The interdisciplinary nature of Duke allows incoming students to learn more than just their intended major and gain valuable academic, social and life skills by the time they graduate. The culture at Duke stimulates an atmosphere of doing your best while also having fun so it is the best for students who have those goals. The professors are funny and insightful, helping you fall in love with every class. There are some improvements needed such as the Quad-Ex housing system, however, it is a relatively new system introduced and I am sure it will improve over time. Duke has everything you can ask for in a university and my short experience has been wonderful. The people, places and projects there will help you settle in quickly.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The professors are incredibly supportive and helpful and want you to succeed. They understand that we all have lives and full time jobs are accommodating if we need it. Feedback is constructive and prompt. The information will help me succeed in my future career
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the collaborative environment of Duke University and how everyone is there to help each other out.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think Duke University is a fantastic institution that truly cares about its students' success. Academics are quite difficult, yes, but there are countless resources for those that need them. I wish the administration listened more to students, though. Sometimes it feels like our critiques are never listened to, especially ones from our BIPOC, women-identifying, and LGBTQ+ populations. I don't think it's fair that tuition increases every year either, especially since we're not seeing a correlated increase in the quality of our education or standard of living. QuadEx is an awful program that should never have been implemented, some of our favorite restaurants have been closed down, and the campus transportation system is really quite awful, which affects pretty much every other aspect of life on campus. However, I know that things can be better and I know that at its heart, Duke is an institution that cares about us and if we can make our voices heard, perhaps things can change.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke University is its own bubble filled with a diverse student population and staff. At Duke, everyone strives for academic excellence, and as a student-athlete, I strive for both academic and athletic excellence. My point of view is a little different for most of the student population, but I still believe it is valuable nonetheless. There are many different aspects to like at Duke University. A few include: the sense of community, the strive for excellence, the beautiful campus, the city of Durham, etc. There is always lots to do, and because the university is on the smaller side, there are lots of familiar faces to see (and therefore many friends to make). There are a few things that might need some changing. These include: the bus system and the parking.  I would like to see more buses running throughout the day to make it easier to get to class without leaving your room 20 minutes before. I also think there is never enough parking available! These are common complaints on campus!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The  campus was beautiful. The teachers were kind and  good. The students were friendly and open and it was easy to make friends.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think Duke is the perfect balance of academics and leisure. The school spirit is unmatched and something I appreciate. A lot of professors are truly dedicated to their craft and care deeply about the students' and our education. Some professors can be challenging to deal with and not as organized, but there are a lot of resources on campus that are available for students. The food is also amazing compared to other schools, many options.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke is a highly stressful academic environment- often unnecessarily. The campus is beautiful and the food is great for college food, but I feel the university does not prioritize the welfare of their students over their reputation.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Academically weak. Racism is endemic. Professors don't seem to care. Way too much focus on sports, and we're not even that good.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke University is an amazing college with a beautiful campus. The student life is thriving and the community is connected in every way imaginable.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Great faculty, great opportunity, great students.
Not only do you get amazing academics, but a dedicated faculty and intelligent student body. The amazing athletics is a bonus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke University has been a dream come true. The faculty are positive and encouraging in every way. The online education environment hasn't been difficult to navigate at all.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke has a great balance of a liberal arts education and specialized courses.  The Trinity College of Arts and Sciences offer a variety of majors, and the Pratt School of Engineering offers four engineering majors.  The engineering school is rather small, especially for civil and environmental engineering that one's experience may be a little limited.  Professor quality is very good overall; because it is a research institution though, there are many professors who are more research-oriented than good at teaching.  Good multi-tiered advising system for those with generic academic interests or undecided track.  Student life isn't as dominated by Greek life as other schools that it makes it easier to find one's "own crowd"
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved my experience at Duke and I would never take it back! I learned so many different things at this institution and I hope that everyone can see this review and be inspired to attend Duke.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a former alumni of Duke University, I can confidently say that it is one of the best universities in the world. The academic programs are rigorous, challenging, and thought-provoking, and the faculty members are top-notch and dedicated to providing students with a well-rounded education. The campus is beautiful, with world-class facilities and plenty of opportunities for extracurricular activities. The university also places a strong emphasis on community service and encourages students to get involved in various volunteer projects. Overall, my experience at Duke University was life-changing, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a top-tier education in a supportive and stimulating environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke is a really great University. The professors are extremely knowledgeable and well prepared as a guide to any future goals.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: most fun, had great experience learning from all the professors there. i made some good memories and still am. just the food wasn't much to my liking lol but all great tho, still have 3 more years and i will miss this college
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke is an amazing university that pushes students to be the best, while also sparking creativity and new interests.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Within 4 months of arriving on campus, I found friends I would consider to be of the highest quality. My classes are difficult, but the college offers plenty of resources and study groups that allow you to succeed. I'm not much of a party person, but there is an abundance of party life if you are interested, in addition to sporting events and social gatherings hosted by the school. Overall, Duke has a little bit of everything, allowing you to find people you never thought you would meet. The academics are hard but fulfilling, and as long as you put the work in, it's a wonderful place to be.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great experience. Strong sense of community. Closeness with other students. Terrific school spirit. Lots of extracurricular opportunities. Good environment with Durham
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoyed my time at Duke. The people I met were amazing and the classes were interesting. Duke has fabulous resources for students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is beautiful and has lots of places to study or take a break outside. As part of the Doctor of Physical Therapy Program, the coursework has been very fast-paced and that took some adjustment at first. Once I found my best studying strategies it has leveled out. It is academically challenging.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am a current freshman at Duke University and so far it has been an incredible experience.  My housing (while not amazing) is very livable and I feel that the amenities provided to me are very good, especially the quality of food.  The campus is a very lively place and I always feel like there is something I can do yet I also feel that I have time to relax and enjoy myself.  The teachers and classes are both great and I have already have learned amazing things.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I never expected to fit in at Duke since I was coming from a really small town, but it has been such an enjoyable experience that I would highly recommend it to anyone even considering coming to this college. The professors are really helpful and the class size isn't overbearing to the point that you can't get personal questions answered.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke is a great mix of incredibly intelligent people who are also very social. I turned down MIT, Harvard, UPenn, Stanford, and Yale for Duke! Best decision I ever made!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
It's really good and I enjoy the community and people here. Duke University is multi-faceted in the various opportunities it has to offer. When I arrived I was confused and completely out of my comfort zone. Yet upon arrival Duke held an orientation program that allowed incoming freshmen to interact with upperclassmen and bond with fellow first years through various activities like service projects, lake trips, and other leisure activities. This helped ease my transition and even helped me gain my social footing. Academics on the other hand was another thing. The courses are difficult, yes but they present students with a lovely major positive changes in myself as a person. Similarly, the extracurriculars here at Duke provided a wonderful outlet to push me out of my comfort zone and discover my passions, namely martial arts.

To sum up my experience at Duke has been nothing short of transformative in the best way possible.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Duke University is multi-faceted in the various opportunities it has to offer. When I arrived I was confused and completely out of my comfort zone. Yet upon arrival Duke held an orientation program that allowed incoming freshmen to interact with upperclassmen and bond with fellow first years through various activities like service projects, lake trips, and other leisure activities. This helped ease my transition and even helped me gain my social footing. Academics on the other hand was another thing. The courses are difficult, yes but they present students with a lovely opportunity to push themselves more than they ever have before. This is exactly what I did and I began to see major positive changes in myself as a person. Similarly, the extracurriculars here at Duke provided a wonderful outlet to push me out of my comfort zone and discover my passions, namely martial arts.

To sum up my experience at Duke has been nothing short of transformative in the best way possible.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I've enjoyed the overall experience her so far with friends. I'd say the scene of partying here is very dependent on being in frats or knowing people. If not you end up going to a club every weekend. Very repetitive and boring. People here are also all ginning for the same things so finding someone genuine and friendly without alternative  motives is hard.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Didn't really like the school when I was there, but started to appreciate the school and the student experience more and more when I started graduate school at another top university. Definitely missed my time there. 10/10 would highly recommend to any prospective students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Expensive, but Outstanding school and faculty!! Never had a bad professor. Very supportive and went out of their way to help struggling students. Recommend this school for nursing. The Durham area has good and bad areas. The area around Duke is generally pretty safe. However there is an issue with parking. Students try to live nearby and rile their bikes to campus. The food is great, but pricey. The Durham area is really good for night life. Really great places to eat!!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I did a summer certification program at Duke University on Global Mathematics. I really enjoyed the course content as well as had a great time with the other students and faculty. I strongly recommend it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love how Duke University provides so many extracurricular opportunities to students and introduces them before one even starts freshman year. For example, there are so many fine arts, music, and research based clubs that students can participate in. I believe this mindset of exploration and openness to so many different subjects can really help those who are currently deciding between two or more majors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke has been an extremely enjoyable experience. The campus life and campus activities are so entertaining and I meet new people at every event. Every student and faculty member are incredibly friendly and enjoyable to be around.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke is space where you are not only obtaining a wealth of knowledge from textbooks and professors, but also learning about the people around you and yourself. Students are able to explore and learn about new cultures and ways of life while simultaneously becoming the most authentic version of themselves. Duke’s community is tight nit and supportive of its students and accomplishment. Cheering on friends at sporting events and performances were some of my favorite things to do. Duke brought me life long friends and memories, I will cherish forever.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I can’t even begin to describe how duke university has been one of the best experiences of my life.
The day I landed in Durham I was set aback by how slow the city was as compared to most cities in India, but the more time I spent the more I began to acknowledge the serenity of this college town. The craze for basketball is on a whole new level at the Harvard of the south. Even though it hasn’t been long since I joined Duke, I have to say, the experience has been nothing short of life changing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke is a perfect place to gain experience, connections, and a leg up on a lot of other people your age. Especially if you are interested in research, you have so many opportunities encouraged and available to you. While it isn’t extremely competitive, there are some people who take their academics very seriously, and may not be as open to collaboration. The social scene is a complete contrast to how well everyone performs in the classroom.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

The parking lots are a good walk away from the buildings most of the time so add walking time to your commute if you are a grad student. Student Health is phenomenal. Cocoa Cinnamon is a great coffee shop that everyone should try at least once to get coffee (tea or hot chocolate) and churros. The city of Durham is beautiful so explore it if you get a chance.

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have enjoyed my time at Duke so far. I am learning at a fast pace and I feel like this is where I belong to obtain my degree.

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke is a great university. I love seeing all the diversity in campus - in terms of race as well as people’s interests. The students are very driven and work hard, but we’re not lacking in the social scene either.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke is a great school with tons of academic, extracurricular, and social opportunities for its students. Many of Duke's majors/minors are flexible and easy to combine, so I was able to study what truly interested me while still getting a well-rounded education. The strong level of professor engagement also sets Duke apart; I became close with many of my professors who served as mentors, advisors, and friends throughout college and even now after graduation. It's easy to get involved with research, study abroad, or engage in other opportunities that interest you. Duke has a diverse social scene, so there really is a place for everyone, but it can be challenging to navigate the selective organizations. There are hundreds of student groups to join, and most have strong social components too. The food and campus living environment are both superb, and the city of Durham is nearby and nice as well. Duke grads have numerous post-grad opportunities, and I was able to get a great job.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke has a great dance program with great dance professors the performing arts is great here the blue devils is a great mascot the staff is great and the faculty is great I will be considering this college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Best college out there. Everything from the food to the professors to the location to the dorms to the classmates.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke offers the academic opportunities of an Ivy league college with a much more vibrant social life and involved athletic culture. It is truly the best of all worlds, and lives up to its "work hard play hard" reputation. My only critique is that social life can be a bit elitist
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: What I like about duke university is there is lot of things that you want to study for. Another thing I like about this school is you could make new friends and help them out.

The campus is beautiful and it is flexible so you can try out whatever class you would want. The professors are not just there to get paid, but are willing to help you in any situation. The food options are abundant. The safety of the school is also very good. I would extremely recommend Duke University to anyone that is looking to go to college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love how open the professors and counselors are about the school. It is accessible and helpful to receive aid during the college application process from the people of Duke University.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really appreciate the time I spent at Duke and the education I received. They provide numerouse resources to support their students both in their academics, mental and physical health. I just wish I new more about all these resources sooner while I was there. I do hope that Duke continues to cultivate diversity, inclusion, and safty on campus, which is a facet of campus life that I have seen grown over the 4 years I was there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke was the perfect balance between rigorous academics and an active social life. The professors and class offerings were amazing. The Duke campus is beautiful and the Cameron Crazies community is definitely a one-of-a-kind experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great school, LOTS of opportunities, great surrounding area. There are lots of jobs and opportunities to take classes within the research triangle, which is great. Lots of employers use the university system as a funnel, which is also great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Duke has been great, but I would like to see more meaningful involvement from Duke when responding to incidents of hate and bias on campus, as well as greater transparency regarding their response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Additionally, there are amazing opportunities on Duke's campus to get involved in student life and create a meaningful community, but there is also a sense of rigorous academic competition amongst your peers that results in people bragging about their unhealthy habits such as getting no sleep in order to study.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved my experience at Duke - it is the perfect combination of "work hard / play hard". If you enjoy college sports and/or school spirit there is plenty of it!

Overall%20Experience.Review: Best experience of my life. Everything about the school is perfect, from the great food to the comfortable dorms (all with A/C) to the interesting classes and nice professors.

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a hard time choosing between Stanford and Duke, but at the end of the day, I'm so glad that I picked Duke. I love the campus, the food, the professors, the athletics, and the genuine respect and good vibes that everyone gives to other people. I couldn't imagine a better university.

I have learned to think more deeply about my surroundings and individuals, and I feel prepared to face the challenges of the real world once I graduate.

Overall%20Experience.Review: Attending Duke has been the best decision of my life thus far. My experience as a student-athlete, STEM major, and member of the Duke community compelled me to grow in myriad ways, all in a safe environment that prioritized my success. My fellow students were brilliant and passionate in everything they did, and the diversity of thought benefitted everyone on campus. My professors and coaches were dedicated not just to my education in the classroom and on the field, but to my personal and professional development. My many mistakes in all aspects of my life were seen as learning opportunities. And most importantly, after my four wonderful years came to an end, even bigger and better things awaited.

Not your standard cafeteria food; eateries all over campus with food like Mahi Mahi burgers, Prime Rib steak, Ramen, and everything in-between (all on food points). Likewise, there's a 24-hour eatery and off-campus delivery options that you can pay for (Papa Johns, Sushi Love, TGIF, Chinese, Mediterra, etc.) WITH FOOD POINTS!! Obviously basketball season is crazy and amazing; campus is super lively. Football games are also fun and don't get enough credit. Campus is beautiful and dorms are super nice and constantly renovated. When Beyonce's Formation video came out, my professor cancelled our regularly scheduled class material and we analyzed the video + it's impact on modern culture. 10/10 loved everything about Duke.

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Duke University provides an overall amazing experience for students that fit the "work hard, play hard" mold.  There are so many things to do to make the most of your college experience.  

Nearly every aspect of student life at Duke falls into the "Goldilocks Zone" in terms of not being too little or too much, but being "just right".

The best part about being a Duke student is having the power to make the most out of every moment presented to you.  Opportunities at Duke are not simply handed to you.  You must take it yourself, and you must strive to be the best person you can be, and Duke helps you do just that.

The university has very challenging academic classes and professors with great experience.

Something that could improve is the way minority students are treated by the faculty and administration. It is most definitely not fair treatment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Choosing to go to Duke has been one of the best decisions I've ever made. Its campus is BEAUTIFUL; we have lush gardens and there are so many birds here, from towhees to even the occasional hawk. The opportunities here to get involved are almost overwhelming. We have this program called DukeEngage where students go to all parts of the world to work with communities through research and volunteer work. I will actually be going to Costa Rica this summer to help in rainforest restoratuon and conservation through this  program!But what I truly love most about this school is its students. The atmosphere here is not competitive but collaborative. I came to Duke feeling insecure about my qualifications compared to those of the other incoming freshman. But never once did I feel belittled or patronized. Students here want each other to succeed, we want to see each other grow and challenge ourselves to improve. Here at Duke, 'Southern Hospitality' is the real deal!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke University is all I could ever ask for. It truly embodies the 'work hard, play hard' mentality that elite schools so often strive for. You will be busy with schoolwork during the week, but it's easy to stay focused because all your peers will be working just as hard. On the weekends you can let off steam with countless activities going on in and around campus. It's a wonderful balance of rigorous academics mixed with typical college fun.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke is a university with stellar academics. Like any school that is "academically rigorous", it can be stressful at times, so that is not unexpected. Sports are generally a big deal on campus (sports = basketball), and the food is good. It can feel a bit like a bubble though -- Durham is a city rich with life and growth, and while a lot of students don't venture into downtown much, I would recommend it. It has a great food and arts scene, as well as local grassroots organizations who deeply care about improving Durham.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: If I had to go back in time, I would pick Duke again in a heartbeat for my college experience. I was pushed to excel in every aspect. I was surrounded by so many talented and motivated individuals. There was such a breadth of opportunities available at Duke, as well as chances to meet a variety of people and have the fun associated with college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The school is amazing! Work hard, play hard— students take both academic and social life very seriously. Love the environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Its a unique place where academia isn't the only thing we discover. We have a vast world of opportunities just a conversation away. Everyone is willing to help us succeed and we have the chance to travel the world in the name of academia. we get to live in a community of inspiring minds and admirable people.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
As an international student, I had a big cultural shock and housing issues when I arrived. However, the staff really helped me out and is easy to contact.

Also, Duke has wonderful facilities and is well maintained.

The courses and professors are excellent, I am very satisfied.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love it here! It's a very welcoming environment and an extraordinary experience. I go here many times a year and there's always new things to experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the atmosphere at Duke, especially the professors. Even though Duke is a very tough academic school, the professors work with you. However not all professors are understanding and try to help out especially in harder classes when you need the support the most but most are.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke definitely has many positive attributes, especially the academics, athletics, and connections fostered there. My only real complaint is that the social environment can be pretty toxic, with students tending to judge based on status and wealth, and a fragmented housing system. But in terms of classes and opportunities, it's absolutely incredible. Definitely worth the investment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The school is an amazing but challenging experience. Kids are great, education is amazing, professors are amazing, the sports are so fun to watch, the food is good, the dorms are not bad. My very good friend goes there and loves it
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke has an excellent core of teachers, a beautiful campus, and the gardens are one of my favorite places on the planet. There were definitely great people in the student body as well, but overall people there are very self-interested and juvenile. As long as you can navigate that, going to Duke will be a very enjoyable experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke has great academics but I wish they would stop overcharging their students fro everything.  The facilities are great but parking is expensive and not worth the price.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Duke. It has been a great place for me to both learn about myself and the world around me. The campus is beautiful and the student body is very focused on growing and learning!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke University is one of the prestigious University. My experience at the University was awesome right from the professors to the staff and the students too.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I absolutely love my school! I have more school pride than I would have ever anticipated and I highly recommend this university. It is only my first year an I could not be happier here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Duke offers me so much more than what I expected, with various classes offered, flexibility to collaborate and dive into interdisciplinary projects, various certificates and programs to choose from, to friendly and accomodating stuffs in academic, administration, and even nutritionists and mental help. The campus is breathtaking with amazing library and high quality of food provided.
Choosing Duke is definitely one of the best decisions I have made.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review:
In my first semester, I appreciated the experience at Duke University. The Academic Rigor and the power of the school allow many doors to open when you attend this prestigious institution. I know personally that people find jobs swiftly. 
Concerning Diversity, the school representation is similar to the demographic makeup of the U.S. (Except that there is a higher percentage of Asians). With that in mind, many minorities complain but do not realize that this representation is a reality, this is how the rest of the U.S. is regarding variety. It is very diverse in comparison to so many other colleges around the United States. Furthermore, Duke has a plethora of international students ranging from countries like Zambia to Venezuela.
The West campus is gorgeous and East Campus is inviting, but Central Campus is extremely ugly. There is so much to do on campus: parties, food, clubs, and more. Inside of Campus is also very safe.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Honestly the best choice I’ve ever made. Everyone’s intelligence is beyond words and there’s a good range of socioeconomic background people come from. Everyone’s very respectul to each other and to themselves, and the consensus is to work amazingly, amazingly hard. Boundless opportunities are constantly fed to us by the university; everyone here gets summer internships/super high-end jobs with the minimum effort of looking around.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved Duke, pretty much everything about it. I made amazing friendships and had an excellent time. I made strong relationships with my professors, which was key for preparing me for graduate school. Only complaint is that if you are not associated with a frat, there is not much of a party scene. But then again I would be embarrassed to be associated with a frat.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke is incredible. It is a highly rigorous academic institution, but it also provides plenty of opportunities for growth socially, professionally, and even spiritually should people be seeking that. I could not be more thankful to be a student here!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I fell in love with this school when I visited. It not only has great programs; it's faculty is one of the best in America. The people here are super nice.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: This is one of the most prettiest schools in the nation. The school is amazing. They will help you with whatever you need and the basketball games are the best.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke offers a rich and diverse student body, with various opportunities at the students' fingertips. Whether it be socially, academically, and spiritually, Duke prioritizes the student first (past, present, or future).
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke University is one, if not the best, schools out there> they have great programs like FLUNCH where you take your professors out to eat with you, and DukeEngage, where students work in other places funded through the summer. They have some of the best foods in America, and although their basketball team is not the best, they do have a good one. I love the fact that they take new ideas and "make it happen".
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love this school. The food, the academics, the atmosphere, the campus, the athletics, etc. Everything about Duke is great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Duke University because there are excellent facilities and resources available to the students. Unfortunately, I am only here for summer classes so the atmosphere is a little different than during the regular semester.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, Duke was a good school. It's known for its academic rigor, and it definitely was rigorous. There were many opportunities for students to take part of, the campus is beautiful, and you can go places as a Duke Alumnus. However, I wish that some people on campus would be more accepting of others from different backgrounds and with different beliefs. It would be a more welcoming campus for all if this happened. Also, a greater variety of classes to explore different cultures would be nice, along with more professors of color.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: One of the best things about Duke is that it attracts some of the most creative, driven students in the country. There is a certain atmosphere of collaboration that is often absent at universities of the same tier. I also like how Duke encourages traveling abroad (and makes it feasible to do so). Most students participate in DukeEngage or spend a semester abroad which is truly incredible. However, Duke does not do a good enough job of admitting students of a wide variety of backgrounds. Most of the people I've met so far are heterosexual, white, and wealthy.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Excellent experience, perfect academics, athletics, environment. Great return on investment. A lot of campus food options.  
 Need more housing options.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Fantastic experience at an UNDERRATED paradise. Students and faculty have an amazing collaborative environment. Academics are hard but doable, lots of opportunity for extracurriculars. Medical school is a great asset for any medicine related research.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing school spirit and great student body. Active engagement of students is well-displayed and students demonstrate determination to succeed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke is a phenomenal academic institution. There is ample opportunity to explore various majors and coursework, and meet a wide variety of students from various backgrounds. Duke is very helpful and supportive in the employment process leading into graduation.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing school! Wouldn't want to be anywhere else. Work hard play hard is definitely a fitting motto for Duke. Everyone here is smart and academically focused but the parties are still crazy and meet all my expectations about college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: If you aren't entirely decided on what you want to study, or want to combine two fields that don't seem to fit, Duke is the best school available to you. The flexible pathway through Duke is one of its best features, and it guarantees there's something academic for nearly everyone here. Not to mention everything that goes on outside of academics. Whether you're a performance artist, coder, engineer, service-learner, researcher, intense athlete, or a just for fun one, there's a place for you here. If you're anything at all, and looking to challenge yourself, then come to Duke!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Duke is a great school. A lot of dorms are far away from classes because of the different campuses, but generally they are nice and fairly spacious. Some used to not have air conditioning, but thats mostly been fixed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I attended Duke as a transfer student, so I have a different perspective on the school. Attending Duke as a freshman is an integral part of becoming involved in the community, so I would recommend living on East Campus and engage in everything there is at the school!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Student%20Life.Review: Housing for greeks is sad. They live in on campus apartments. Greek people tend to view themselves as superior and it shows, despite the fact that everyone is a nerdy Duke student and wasn't super cool in high school. Non-greeks are hostile towards greeks generally, and greeks tend to be snobby and rude towards non-greeks (especially those in "top" tiers)
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Duke Basketball. Enough said. But there are also other great teams. Warning-the guys will use their status as athletes as an excuse to treat you poorly, but that's every school...
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone is obsessed with Duke basketball.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life for minorities in meaningful. There is NPHC consisting of historically black orgs and MGC for multicultural organizations. But Panhel and IFC (Greek life consisting mainly of white people) is toxic and abusive. Those orgs don't really do much for the community
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I am not too familiar with Greek life on the campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Duke is the home of the Blue Devils. basketball is the main sport on campus. I feel as an athlete myself that basketball is the #1 sport. Athletes support other athletes. The training facilities are good and are currently improving. The facilities for non-athletes are also of good quality.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I have a neutral outlook towards Greek Life at Duke because I am not involved with it. However, most of the stories I have heard from Greek friends deal with parties and drugs instead of philanthropy and brotherhood/sisterhood. There is a social hierarchy among the Greeks based on which group you are in, but thankfully they do not hold the opinion that all independent students are beneath them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: People care about the basketball team too much.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I do an online program so I don't go to sporting events at the school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: They say that it's only 1/3 of students who do greek life--- but it feels like a LOT more.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: School spirit is VERY high! I've actually never gone to an athletic event so far, but I think I'm the only person who hasn't. Duke is the only elite university that you can have this type of athletic experience, as far as I know.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Didn't love the strong connection between your greek affiliation and your relevant social capital - and that's coming from someone in a tier 1 frat. It just always felt a little dehumanizing and I didn't enjoy the stigma of hanging out or dating someone from a lower tier group.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Duke has a perennially nationally ranked basketball team.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: We have some of the best programs and the best school spirit to back it up
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It depends on what you want to get out of Greek life.  I think it is as important as you make it.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Only some of the sports matter, other sports are not as important.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: I think that Greek life plays a really big role in the African American community at my school. Some think that the only way to be noticed and to do great things is by joining a sorority of fraternity, and that is not the case. On the other hand, Greek life gives one new sisters and brothers that are not able to be found anywhere else. We do not have Greek housing for black frats and sororities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: People hate Duke because of Duke Basketball, so it must be pretty good! Athletics, in my opinion, is what brings most of the students together. It is like the students have a different identity and community outside of academics. Athletics make us one big family.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is definitely worth being involved in. Unfortunately, there are no real houses, just apartment buildings on central. Greek life would be more meaningful (in a positive way) if there were houses. It would create a stronger community based off more than just going out together.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics are huge. Being a Cameron Crazie is almost a right of passage, and football is also increasing in popularity as well. Being an athlete here is an amazing experience, probably one of the best universities to participate in sports in the country.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Duke basketball is a HUGE commodity. I don't get into sports much, so I don't know much bout the athletic life at Duke; I've attended just one bball game the entire season (much to the displeasure of my friends). All I know is that the Duke students have a ton of spirit surrounding varsity sports, especially football and basketball, but mostly basketball (i.e. Cameron Crazies).
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I think Greek life represents another realm of stratification at a university that already deals with issues of classism.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: The school spirit is a big perk. It's fun to participate in it. However, the reputation of the schools based on sports rather than academics is frustrating.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: I don't have a good perspective, but independent students generally don't like most frats.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It's Duke, there's plenty to get excited over. Still, no one will physically drag you to sporting events.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Duke athletics is one of the most important part of duke experience. Almost one third students are athletes. It is also very easy to involved with athletics. Cameron craziness is one of the least experience you want to miss here. Simply be there and you will be touched by duke students's school spirit.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Didn't rush, but didn't feel like I needed to to belong.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Cameron indoor...need I say more?
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Basketball is the most important sport and is the one where matches are most attended. I personally do not care much for sports, but the sporting life is important to most students on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Duke has some of the best varsity sports in the nation.  It's great to be involved!
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Better rush quick, fast, and in a hurry. Go to every meeting or you're out... apparently.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Can't complain. Gyms are nice, and everyone loves their basketball team.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is a part of Duke, but it doesn't define it. You can enjoy the social scene without the cliques.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Duke University is known for their basketball, as they have won four NCAA National Championships. It's a great feeling to be in the basketball court, watching a Duke Men's basketball game. Students go all out in blue and white, and we even have chants and hand signals for every different move and penalty that occurs on the court. When basketball season begins, students camp out on the K-ville lawn in front of one of our gyms in order to receive tickets to our rival basketball game against University of North Carolina-Chapel Hill. Duke also has a football team that is on the rise, and the games are full of students cheering on their fellow players. Other sports, such as Women's soccer and Lacrosse, are incredibly great, but they don't receive the praise that basketball and football do. Duke students are full of school spirit, and love to attend sports events, even if it's a losing sport!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am not in a sorority by choice. Greek life is a large part of Duke's campus, even though it is not portrayed that way to upcoming freshman. If you are not involved with Greek life, it definitely does hinder your social life more than one expects.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I am not an athlete, but from what I've seen the athletics seem to be nothing less than the best.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There seems to be a quite huge divide between those in Greek life and those that are not in later years, so consideration of this aspect of social life is important.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone knows about Duke basketball, and it is hard to not hear at least something about it every now and then during the time at Duke. As such, school spirit is not something that is hard to rouse, and oftentimes, even the least avid of sports observers will find themselves cheering in Cameron Stadium.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: As an independent, I think the tier-ranking system of frats and sororities is fairly dumb.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: DUKE BASKETBALL NATIONAL CHAMPIONS 2015. Enough said.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Duke is super passionate and spirited about being a Blue Devil!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: While I'm not crazy about Greek Life in general, I really love my sisters in my sorority and am so happy to have found a home.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Generally, I have not had any issues with the campus administration, but I also have not had much experience to comment much.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Nothing really to complain about.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Campus strictness is great in that it keeps people safe and respecting each other, but it never makes people feel scared or like they're being punished.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I have not had much interaction with the Administration.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The Blue Devils galvanize a campus-wide fandom that is a phenomenon unto itself. Cameron Crazies are undoubtedly the most fervent, outspoken, and intellectually inspired of their kind.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The student body is incredibly impressive. I have  deep respect for almost all of them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: This is Duke. Enough said.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is a dangerous, harmful force on this campus.  Many people I know were really hurt by the rush process, by being in a chapter, or by trying to have a social life an an independent.  Even though only 1/3 of students are Greek, it is clear that they dominate the social scene (or at least think they do).
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Policies are very unclear about guests and drinking
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I love it as a sorority member but we are not seen positively
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Hierarchy is a thing and I wish it weren't. Not just Greek
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Duke sports are a big part of campus life and very fun events to attend.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not used to this sort of freedom, so anything seems lenient.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The varsity athletics program at Duke is phenomenal and makes it really easy to have tons of school spirit. The club and intramural sports aren't as big of a deal, but they are still well-participated in and fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The university is very strict about underage drinking and drinking in the dorms, but for good reason. I wish the university was no so strict about throwing parties, though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life can often times seem a bit cliquey, and being a guy, it is very difficult to get into fraternity parties unless I have girls with me. I'm not a big fan of the Greek system at Duke, which is why I chose an alternative.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Duke has one of the best athletic programs in the nation.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The greek life is available, but not overpowering.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: School policies do not seem very strict but I have not had experience with them
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is huge school spirit around athletics and also many club sports
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life provides a lot of parties on campus, but also charity
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's alright in general. There are a few and there aren't a few.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The school doesn't place many boundaries on what students are or are not allowed to do. As long as you don't do something stupid or overly attention-seeking, the school usually will not get into your business
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Known as one of the biggest basketball schools, it's without a doubt that sports are huge. Intramural and club sports don't fall behind much and many individuals are also involved.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Duke seems to have taken a tougher stance on the illicit activities inherent to Greek organizations, such as hazing, excessive alcohol consumption, and drug use. Otherwise, it exercises considerable (and appreciated) leniency for students who operate on an "all things in moderation" principle. If a student becomes incapacitated, for example, the campus police's first directive is to secure that student's safety and wellbeing. From an academic standpoint, Duke abides by the honor code to which all students pledge. Of all the offenses one could incur, plagiarism is usually the most dire.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The most commonly voiced complaint about Greek life at Duke is that the fraternities and sororities control the vast majority of social activities, and, to some extent, that is true. However, those activities are largely homogenous; if your interests extend beyond aimlessly drinking in the fraternity and sorority houses with an occasional dose of formal events, alternatives are certainly available. Selective living groups (SLGs) constitute another avenue of fostering a communal atmosphere among students. Ostensibly, they are more accepting and diverse in purpose than the Greek organizations.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: While Greek life isn't for everyone, who ever wants to be a part of this can easily do so.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It is a very accepting environment, whether that be for sexual orientation, ethnicity, economic status etc.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I think this university portrays a mixture of both a southern school and a northern school. I think the economic status of the students' families are fairly easy to assess based on the social culture created at the school. While there may be some socio-economic differences between students, for the most part there is a tight-knit community feel, and no one is left out.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Duke is really pretty lenient about most everything that doesn't make them look bad.  They understand that their students are going to party, and are going to drink, and as long as freshman aren't being obvious, they can drink whenever.  Other then that, as long as you aren't being openly racist, sexist, or classist, you can do a lot without problems.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Never had a problem or heard of problems with the campus police.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Only 40% of Duke is Greek. But if you're in one camp vs the other, then chances are most of your friends are affiliated/non-affiliated.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Campus strictness varies. In terms of drinking, East Campus (freshmen campus) is completely dry, but you can drink on West or Central pretty easily. Parking sucks and if you park without a permit, your car can get towed/impounded. Duke is pretty lenient about visitation in dorms; you don't have to sign anyone in.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I think it depends on who you hang out with. Overall, the school is very diverse, but individuals groups of people are more homogenous.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Duke has three gyms, one for each campus: West, East, and Central. Wilson, the gym on West, is one of the best athletic facilities I have ever used (better than some in NYC and in Chicago). It has three-levels with dozens of cardio machines, a brand new weight room, a cycling room, a rock-climbing wall, and offers gym classes throughout the week.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Most Dukies are athletic and put a decent amount of effort into their appearances.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Not being involved in Greek Life but still having an interest in being social can be difficult at times. Every fraternity and sorority is different, but I'd say most are generally accepting. As for Greeks/non-Greeks, I'd say the non-Greeks can be judgmental of the system, but less often of individual people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Diversity at Duke is very good, I'd say, especially compared to a lot of other communities/college campuses. That being said, Duke minority students, I'd say, are very VERY aware of their minority status and of their reception on campus.  This isn't always a good thing or the best feeling. The conversations that need to be had are being had, though, and I'd say the community is pretty good about providing space and opportunities for those conversations to take place.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Hookup culture is alive and well at Duke. Seeing a couple is a rare occurrence at Duke. But guys are well dressed and mostly nice, and the same for girls.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: If you love Greek Life, this school is for you. If you like the whole rankings of greek life, then definitely come here. It's only 30% of the school, but they are very vocal about it. The fact that there is nothing going on off-campus means that they're the only activities that are going on at school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: School is rather strict in some areas but lenient in others. You don't need to check your guest in your dorm whenever you have a visitor unlike most schools.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman
