Student%20Life.Review: I don't mind strictness, but from the police, it tends to be targeted at ethnic minorities, instead of the whole Duke community. Admin also seems more strict when it comes to these minorities, but as a whole people hide things very well.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Sexism and racism are still very much alive here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Do not come here if you are looking for diversity. All white and rich.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Eh. Guys are obnoxious frat guys that will make millions someday. If you can find one who isn't flexing in the mirror all the time, don't let go.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Sororities and fraternities matter a lot on campus. They dictate the social hierarchy and social scene. That being said, if you are apart from it, it doesn't really matter.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: You can basically do anything you want except for cheat or plagiarize. Don't cheat... you get thrown out.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Haven't had any run ins with campus police
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: With one of the top basketball programs in the nation, winning four national titles, and led by Coach K, the success and common interest in the basketball team brings the school together and generates hope for success unthinkable at a Top 10 institution. The football team is also on the rise, and the facilities for non-athletes are very nice as well.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The administration really allows students almost total freedom, not spending much time looking into alcohol or drug use. The school does place a lot of value in its honor code.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It's very hard to find students in serious relationships at Duke, with a student body overwhelmingly interested in themselves. The students are extremely well put together, looking like a page out of a J Crew photo shoot. The social life revolves around drinking and partying, with few clubs that promote activities without alcohol. You find a diverse mix of types at Duke, ranging from preppy, alpha male types to extremely nerdy individuals. As someone who would identify as a 'nerd,' I'd say it's been difficult to find students who truly hold similar interests. The girls are decent-looking, in very good shape, and follow the same spectrum of party all the time types to bookworms. I'd say most students at Duke are well-groomed, driven, drink alcohol at least once/week, and present a 'cool nerd' image.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Duke provides outlets for students of diverse backgrounds to find other like-minded students, but oftentimes looks to emphasize its diversity at the expense of the student. The student likes to show off their wealth, making students from lower economic classes uncomfortable.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek Life allows a bunch of snotty, rich kids the freedom to party, drink, and belittle other groups of people. Moreover, it promotes a culture of anti-intellectualism at Duke, while making it difficult for students to find a living group unless they party.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The university has become a leading forum for open exchanges across students from all walks of life. I would rank Duke's diversity among its most impressive and distinctive qualities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: On the whole, the students are very good looking, and approximately 35% of them are in relationships. The other 65% sometimes borders on ridiculously immature and hookup-obsessed, but I don't think that's exclusive to Duke.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is a great deal of diversity on this campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The degree of campus strictness appears to be appropriate.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I've never had a problem.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Diversity of students around campus is ok, but when actually observing social culture, people of different race, economic background, etc stay together. Leading to a lack of unification as a class, or school
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I think that Duke is fair when it comes to these issues.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Very diverse campus. Lots of activities to support different minority groups and awareness
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is diversity in the student body, but it's easy to gravitate towards and surround yourself with people who are similar to you
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: You will suffer consequences if you are a total idiot, but if you are reasonable you'll be fine
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Over rated. Before coming here I read so much about the "hot" student body and was so let down once I actually got here...
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Duke says were are truly diverse in the student profile online but we truly aren't. If you visit campus you will notice a huge white and asian population with few minorities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: People are snobs here. One thing to consider is the social scene when applying. Many stuck up individuals...
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life at Duke is perfect. It is not overwhelmingly powerful as it is at big southern public schools. At Duke it provides a tightly-knit group of friends and numerous social opportunities.However, it does not seclude you from friends in other fraternities or non-Greek students. Some of my best friends are in different fraternities and they hang out in my section frequently.  The Greek students have an overall higher GPA than the non-Greek community and are generally more involved in on-campus activities and clubs.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Duke provides the perfect college atmosphere. You can buy alcohol on campus and walk around with it. As long as you aren't cheating in school, Duke tends to try to stay out of your life, allowing you to make your own personal decisions
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is a great deal of diversity at Duke. That being said, different types of people tend to self select into smaller groups. That is not always the case and stereotypically homogenous settings such as Greek Life are more diverse than the public thinks.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Duke could not care less about you. You are simply a walking paycheck to the school. As long as you do not get caught and embarrass the school, do whatever you want.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: A bunch of rich white kids. There are a lot of kids who try to champion gay rights and foreign policy and some secondary shit. But in terms of fitting in if youre even a bit different, good luck. They resent you being there, so be ready.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The school supports it way too much, using them as a crutch to replicate close communities within the student body living quarters. But instead, the system produces a very noticeable caste system, where top frats and sororities compete for status, while the overall feeling towards non greek students can be a bit concerning. Instead of fostering a community where everyone is included, you feel the need to join any frat or sorority in order to not be left out of the party scene. And the whole selection process for women is unbelievably inappropriate, shallow and quite annoying because it creates a lot of drama that could be avoided.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I think over all the school enforces safety rules but is open to things such as expanding clubs and interest groups
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: pretty diverse school and community
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I don't know too much about this being off campus and in grad school
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Its pretty diverse. Rich white kids are the majority
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Its really easy to get involved in sports. There are awesome gyms/athletic areas available. Its easy to get involved in both varsity and intramural/club sports
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I love the sports scene here, all-around.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I ended up joining when I was 100% sure I wouldn't
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They understand kids want to have fun, and as long as you're doing it safely, it doesn't become a problem.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: People are pretty attractive at duke and have many interest.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Athletic facilities at Duke are great. Most of the spirit is around our top-rate basketball program although football has been in a upswing and more support has been given. Soccer is pretty popular too but not in the same way basketball is.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: There are all kinds of people at Duke from all over the country and world. Yet Duke is definitely a very affluent place considering that only 40% of students receive financial aid. Duke is pretty liberal but there is sizable conservative population. And there is an active LGBTQ center.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Greek like at Duke is a world until its self. Personally, I was never a part of greek life at Duke which didn't have negative affects on my social life. Fraternities have eligibility have to dedicated wings of dorms for their frat while sororities don't have this luxury. Greeks through a lot of parties on campus with few other alternatives for partying. Yet there are plenty of other social outlets. How are Greeks students view by non-Greeks? I guess that depends on who you are asking. Personally, I have found Greek students to be hard working, generally white affluent and somewhat disconnected from other communities at Duke and in Durham. Many Greeks adopt the motto of "Work Hard. Play Hard" Which consist of studying hard and partying hard.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: We've got a nice gym facility on West and East campus, Central has a small gym as well.  The pools aren't great, but they are clean and functional.  Varsity sports are well supported, for the most part.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It's socially unacceptable to be unaccepting.  There will be campus uproar in cases of racism and poor LGBTQ relations.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review:
Greek life dominates the social scene at Duke. There are SLGs (selective living groups), which are essentially co-ed housing groups that have a rush process and select whom they would like to become members, but their budgets are minimal, as is their control of the social scene.
There is a slew of fraternities, and if you play the rush process even reasonably intelligently, you'll have no problem getting a bid. Girls are guaranteed bids if they simply play by the rush rules of the Panhellic Council.  Greek life is divisive at Duke, as it is at all schools that have it.  Although the social scene might be better and more diverse if the Greek system didn't exist at Duke, it does exist, and it has a generally positive impact on the opportunities in the form of parties, mixers, pregames, formals and venue rent-outs. There's a range of fraternities and sororities, and a social hierarchy absolutely exists, but most people are secure with where they are and enjoy their social experience it seems. The Greek system at Duke is overall solid. There is no "frat row," though, and Greek housing consists of fraternity and sorority members living together in a section of a dormitory or central campus apartment complex.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: One of the top athletic programs in the country with an immense amount of tradition and scholarship.  A model athletic department.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is a huge amount of diversity, and I feel like overall the campus is very accepting.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I ain't about that Greek life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm in a long-term long distance relationship with someone from high school, but I've seen a lot of relationships spring up within the first semester of my freshman year. There's a wide range of people, those who like casual hook-ups and those who like more committed and serious relationships. Guys are TALL here, and a lot of them are pretty attractive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is nothing quite like Duke basketball; just do a Google image search of "Cameron Crazies," and you'll get a taste of the spirit Duke students have. Sports give the campus a unified feeling, and create a really strong community (plus they're a nice break from the stress of academic life).
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: DUKE BASKETBALL. enough said. Seriously though having such a high level basketball team really inspires a lot of school spirit. Going to the games in Cameron is so much fun and football games are great too! It's a very athletic campus in general, lots of people play club or intramural sports and like to go to the gym and keep fit. Athletics provides a great balance with the amazing academics.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Duke treats students as adults and works to keep students safe rather than looking for reasons to punish students. East Campus is a dry campus, meaning that an alcohol policy is more strictly enforced, whereas West Campus is not. Duke PD is much more focused on keeping students safe rather than getting people in trouble.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is a big part of the social scene on campus, but it is by no means the entire social scene. We also have SLGs (selective living groups) and an new housing model for independent houses that promotes community among students regardless of affiliation. Greek life is much less divisive than at other schools, and having spring rush allows students to take a semester to figure out if joining a Greek organization would be the right fit! There are many open parties especially in the fall semester as well as a lot of events put on by greek organizations and other organizations alike that are at off campus venues, not just in frat houses. Greek life contributes to the vibrant social scene on Duke's campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It is an extremely snobby little campus, and the students are very unfriendly. Everyone is either depressed or just not interested in socializing. If you want an enjoyable college experience, this is about the last place on earth you would look.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone is ambitious, smart and nice
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Duke is the paradise for sports lover!!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Really overrated (I am in a "good" fraternity here). I could see the University getting rid of Greek Life altogether within the next 30 years. It almost seems like Duke University's administration is making it their mission to stamp out fraternities from the school and they seem to have this innate hatred for us. The school is incredibly hard on us. The only reason that the school hasn't gotten rid of them yet is that the school gets an absurd amount of endowment money from Duke alums in Greek Life (WAY more than any other group).
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Pretty average. A lot of kids simply are not social at all i.e. all they do is study.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Appropriate requests from on campus security
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: on the things that really matter, duke is strict. On the other hand, trivial violations are often turned a blind eye on.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Duke upholds high standards of excellence.  They encourage students to have an active social life but to be responsible when making choices and accept the consequences of their choices.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life almost dominates the social scene too much. The parties tend to be fairly wild, but sometimes more interesting events are hosted (more often by selective living groups, however).
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Duke students live for basketball season. Cameron Crazies live in a tent for weeks in Krzyzewskiville for a spot at the Duke-UNC game. This tradition brings the school together, and supports the basketball team that Duke Students take so much pride in.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Duke isn't pretty strict if you are partying on campus. Most cops are hired to patrol parties to make sure that they do not get out of control. However the ALE is VERY strict if you are caught drinking off of Duke campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Basketball goes without saying, it's the best in the country.  Simply the atmosphere in Cameron Indoor is an experience like no other.  Although basketball is a large source of excitement around Duke campus, they do a good job of promoting and supporting the other sports as well. There is room to improve on making the atmosphere at football games closer to that of the basketball arena, but this past year they did a pretty spectacular job with improving the intro video, fan involvement, half time shows, and use of fireworks etc.   Additionally, other sports have excelled and won many championships, which Duke does a good job recognizing their successes and hard work.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Varsity sports at Duke are taken very seriously. The athletes are treated like mini-gods here. The training and workout facilities are top notch. During men's basketball games, the student crowd never sits. Fans are named Cameron Crazies, and tenting for the march Duke vs. UNC game starts in January. Cameron stadium was ranked as the 2nd most intimidating venue for visiting teams. Club sports are recognized, too, and as far as the rowing team goes, varsity and club are co-joined.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Duke has a mix of people. Like any other college, there are people who a pretty and athletic. There are smart people and people you wonder how the heck they got here. I think Duke does a good job of trying to find some diversity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It is a huge part of campus, it is a lot of fun to go to games, especially basketball games!!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Many students who come to Duke are able to pay their full tuition, and the students on scholarships, myself included, are sometimes baffled at economic disparity around campus, as evident through the different clothes, lifestyle, cars, etc.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: We kick ass at everything from Basketball to Rugby and everything in between, kinda. DUKE DEVILS!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I'm a non-Greek, but based on what I've heard and seen, all those involved in Greek life seem to enjoy it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
Duke Basketball games are completely insane, and so much fun!  The football games are popular too, with tailgating nearly every weekend.

The campus gym is beautiful, complete with a rock climbing wall and indoor pool, in addition to the usual gym machines.  Duke offers several free workout classes.  The IM league is lots of fun as well.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Varsity sports at Duke are pretty top-notch. Our basketball team is one of the best college basketball teams in the United States, and of course, we do have the amazing Coach K. The other sports here are also well-attended and very successful, as shown by our football team, who made it to a Bowl game.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: At Duke there are two main campuses, East and West. The East campus is a dry campus, so if you're caught with alcohol you can be cited, but its not uncommon for people to drink on east and get away with it. West campus is the exact opposite of East. You're allowed to have 6 beers on you at a time in the open on east, even if you're underage, without any repurcussions. The real problem like any school is breaking the honor code. If you are caught cheating you are in a world of trouble.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I've been very impressed by the level of diversity here, especially compared to my undergrad campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I was pleasantly surprised with the amount of attractive people at this school - both boys and girls. Everyone is really interested in staying in shape, and the amazing gym and running trails around campus definitely help.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is great because it is there for those who want it, but doesn't dominate the social life too much. Only about a fourth of guys and a third of girls go greek, with the rest staying independent or joining SLGs (selective living groups). SLG's are a great alternative to greek life and offer the same kind of social/intellectual community without the same intensity or a national affiliation. Especially first semester, all frat parties are open to the whole school and you will rarely if ever be turned down to get in one. Sororities don't live together in sections like the frats do, bust most girls choose to block with girls in the same sorority. I've find that a lot of frat guys and sorority girls really break the stereotype for greeks.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I'm Greek myself, a member of Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc. I personally feel that the Greek life here on campus can be a lot stronger. Yes, we throw tons of parties but the emphasis should be on improving the community! And when we do make the moves to do just that, we need not for our administration to overlook our efforts.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: For the most part, Duke has an incredibly attractive student body. Guys and girls hale from all over the United States, as well as the world. You'll have your surfer guys and girls, sorority row, fraternity row, attractive representations of the African diaspora and so much more! Although many students are attractive, the ambitious air that permeates the campus gives many of them a very haughty view on everyday situations.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life can be as a big or small a part of your life as you want it to be (It is not necessary to go Greek). In many ways, it very much stratifies the social scene and comes with stereotypes, but that is not to say the benefits or being in a fraternity or sorority--such as brother/sisterhood, philanthropy, social events, etc.--are not present.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The Greek life is rampant and active. Not too exclusive or a bad influence on campus but does not have a good relationship with the administration.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Shooters Socializing – Dress code varies, from polished, preppy to scrubby athletic. Girls and guys are good looking if you look hard enough or just go to Shooters
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Cookie Cutter – Everyone looks and dresses the same for the most part. Guys are fratty and wear pinnies and khakis and girls wear sundresses or gym clothes. Lots of school spirit and Duke attire but other than that, not too much variation.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Tailgate Cancelled – Duke tailgate was a tradition that brought diverse groups of students together before football games. However, due to an unfortunate happening, tailgates have been permanently cancelled, putting a damper on game days. However, this just means more build up for basketball season.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Not Bad – Campus Police are very understanding with drinking, but it's parking that will get you.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Sooo International – The thing is, you think that there is a lot of kids from every sort of background. A lot of Caucasian, DEFINITELY a lot of Asiann, a decent amount of Black students , kids from all over the US, and many many many international kids-- Europe, Africa, Middle East, etc. My personal friend group includes natives of Queens, Jersey, Turkey, France, England, Kuwait, New Zealand... scattered
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Duke strives for diversity, but the school is majority white. Many of the international students are Asian and predominantly Chinese. The other races/ethnicities either stick to their own people or individually join the majority. Duke seems to be accepting of the LGBT community, but there is an overwhelming sense of conservatism at times.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: If Only Football Was More Popular – Duke basketball is amazing, no doubt. But often I wish that we show more pride in our football team. I've been to colleges where their football teams are well-known. On football game days, the whole campus is crowded with fans who are not college students. It was also an all-day event, which made the campus feel more of a community. On basketball game days at Duke, if you're not at K-Ville, it's hard to tell that it is a game day.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's Strict, but Not That Much – You can get away with most things if you are off-campus. Slap in the wrist if you end up getting caught drinking. If you try committing academic dishonesty though, nothing can save you
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Great Sports Opportunities for Everyone – Whether you're Kyle Singler or a freshman noob, sports thrive at Duke University. There are over a dozen intramural sports to choose from, dozens of club sports, and nationally-recognized sports teams to follow every season. And that's not even mentioning Cameron Indoor Stadium. That place is out of control.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: They Are Awsome – there are many great duke teams that give much school pride
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Alcohol Is Lenient, Cheating Is Severe – Duke has very severe consequences for students who are caught cheating or plagiarizing, but the consequences for underage drinking are none, if at all. I would say on the whole that the administration is pretty lenient towards student consequences. Sexual assault is also calls for severe consequences that may involve not only the undergraduate student conduct board, but also local police.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Girls Are Hotter Than Guys – There are way more attractive girls at Duke than guys.  There are a few good-looking Frat-stars and Lacrosse players, but we all know about their reputation.  Most of the guys here are a little nerdy looking, and not in an adorably dreamy Adam Brody kind of way.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Unparalleled School Spirit – Duke is famous for our school spirit. College basketball is hardly complete with ESPN coverage of our Cameron Crazies, and no amount of school spirit can compare to sleeping in tents for months for tickets, painting yourself blue and jumping up and down throughout an entire basketball game with 500 of your closest friends.

Aside from basketball, there are infinite opportunities to watch or partake in other sports from the varsity and general competitive club sport levels to intramurals and individual workout. We have a very spacious and well-maintained athletic facility on the main campus as well as several other facilities all over campus, all of which are extremely accessible to all students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It's hard to avoid Greek life if you don't want to be a part of it. As a girl, it doesn't really matter if you join a sorority or not. Many aren't that close with each other anyway. As a guy, fraternities can define your social life and elevate your status. Other options such as Selective Living Groups (SLGs) exist.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Easy for minority groups to self-segregate, but school offers many programs/events to increase awareness of diversity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: East Campus Is Dry – Freshman live on East Campus, which is a dry campus and alcohol is not tolerated. West Campus and Central Campus are more lax. Generally, as long as a person is in control, not causing harm to a fellow student or the property and is not loud and boisterous, there is no repercussions. There are a lot of highly varied activities on campus that are put on by RAs and campus groups. Academics are strict, perjury and plagiarism are not acceptable in the least.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Lax but Academically Rigorous – There aren't many restrictions on us, we pretty much come and go as we please but it is very academically challenging here, so we take it upon ourselves to restrain from crazy things.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Strict but Fair – Though punishments are served when necessary, safety is the priority. If your friend is in need of medical attention, you are free to contact campus security with no fear of getting yourself in trouble and only a minor note on your friend's file.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Diverse to a Degree – Lots of sexual diversity, and racial diversity, too, but people seem to stick to their own kind with their friendships.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Look I don't like Basketball nor will I ever, but you can't help vibing with the enthusiasm this school emanates. Come basketball season, the quads will be cleared because everyone's cramming into the nearest room they can find with a TV channel tuned in to ESPN2. The school is obviously one of the top in basketball, but the amazing thing is how the entire school rallies around them to have the team continue. And the gyms on campus are a perfect place to go if you think you can be an athlete of your own. ;)
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Appearance-Conscious Enough to Keep the Gyms Full – Not your typical daddy's little girl or momma's boy. Not a whole lot of emphasis on brands or makeup or anything, but enough to keep the gyms full of students who want to keep in shape. Both genders are very attractive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greeks Are Present – The Greek life is there for those who want it, and the parties are there for those who want to go to them. However, Greek life not overwhelming.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not Super Strict – Be discreet and you'll be fine. They're there to make sure you don't die.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: School Spirit – Everyone is very proud to be a blue devil, despite our sometime conception as being dousches.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: NO RULES!!!! Duke only worries about plagiarism and cheating. Unless you're doing something explicitly dangerous or a more violent crime, you will often get a slap on the wrist if you're caught at all. People often brag about drinking out of solo cups in front of police officers, and as long as you are with friends and not passed out or acting belligerent, you will be ok. Drugs are less tolerated, but once again that's if you get caught. People often stash liquor in their fridges, even on east campus which is supposedly "Dry".
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: So Many International Students – There are so many international students in every class. On top of that, they are international students from literally all over the place.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We suck at football, but who cares because we have DUKE BASKETBALL. The other varsity sports are talented as well, but not as fun to watch.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The black people here really self segregate. I'm not being racist, I am black.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The Police Are Your Friends...Pretty Much – The Duke police do absolutely nothing when they see people drinking alcohol.  The RAs give the policy about which type of alcohol you can distribute and which you can't, but I have yet to see this strictly enforced.  The party scene (but not the entire social scene) revolves around the Greeks, but they're fun!  Getting alcohol couldn't be easier; just walk up and ask.  If you're at a party on Central Campus, make sure everyone goes inside the apartment so it won't get shut down.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
Not Many Relationships – The dominant style for guys on campus is pretty fratty - think lots of lax pinnies, and often corresponding attitudes to go with them. Both guys and girls here generally fall into 2 categories - ones who care about their appearance and put effort into looking perfect, or nerdy ones who wouldn't know good clothes if they hit them in the face or are too busy studying to care about their looks. 
Dating isn't really a thing at Duke; hooking up (especially while drunk) is the norm. This is especially true in the Greek scene, from what I'm told by Greeks.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not Strict – The only recent crackdown has been on tailgate.  Sometimes RAs on East Campus are strict about it being a dry campus.  Other than that, Duke is not very strict with visitors, drinking, parties, etc.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Basketball...Enough Said – Sports are a huge part of Duke.  Students wait for days in tents to get basketball tickets.  Tailgate before football games was a huge social aspect.  Lacrosse is another huge favorite, both for boys and girls teams.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Fraternity Guys – I am from the west coast, and was shocked to see how prevalent the classic east coast frat bro image was. Vineyard Vines, khakis, Barbour jackets, polos and pocket tees, Sperry topsiders, etc. are the usual and the norm. Takes a second to get used to guys dressing like your dad on the golf course, but at times it can be kinda hot vs. the sloppy laid back California bro outfit...
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Pretty Diverse – There are many people of different races, different economic statuses, from different countries. There are students from private school, public schools, charter schools. While there are a lot of white students, there is a very large proportion of Asians (~30%) and some other minorities on campus. While they may be a smaller percentage, the Center for Race Relations, Women's Center, LGBT Center, multi-cultural groups, etc. are all very prominent in the community.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Administration, What Administration? The freshmen dorms are "dry" and that is strictly enforced for the most part, but upperclassmen are free to do pretty much anything. There have been some limitations put on the social scene recently, (the end of tailgate, etc.) but for the most part, it isn't too strict.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Sports Dominated World – Sports are a huge deal and there is a lot of student support, especially for basketball obviously. Varsity athletes' lives are completely different from other students'. They have four hour practices most days of the week, and have to put it in extreme amounts of time, which makes them inaccessible to other students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Diverse, Tolerant, Yet Segregated – The campus is really diverse, more in terms of ethnic group than socioeconomic status. Students as a whole are very accepting and tolerant of diversity, but you will find that many groups tend to self-segregate, which is just the way it is. This self-segregation is not unique to Duke and shouldn't be regarded as inhibitory in any way.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's Preppy, but That's Probably a Good Thing. Duke has much more attractive people than any other top university. The school is very fratty, but there's a large independent crowd that manages to enjoy life just as well.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: East campus, the freshman campus, is dry and you will get in trouble if you have an open container of alcohol (although many RA's will overlook drinking as long as it is kept inside dorm rooms and thing don't get too rowdy). If you are underage on West Campus you probably want to drink indoors but it is far less strict. In general, the Duke police and Duke administration don't want to get you in trouble, they just want students to stay safe. It is not a good idea to drink off campus underage. Durham police are far less friendly and the ALE is known to cite people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: THE BEST – One word: TENTING. Basketball is the best. Though Football isn't that good, every single person goes to tailgate, which is absolutely amazing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Students have a pretty laid back approach as to what to wear during the day, but will dress up to go out at night.  Longchamp purses, rainbows, vineyard vines, and Duke Tshirts can be seen everyday.  The party scene is pretty large and sometimes overwhelming- it feels like everyone is going partying on West Campus and fliers advertising these parties and beer cans are everywhere. It's easy to get in a party, but there are also other things to do, although sometimes not as noticeable.  Free movies, sports games, going out clubbing or just having a nice dinner are also common.  Most social events probably depend on the organization you're in- varying from being involved in greek life to music to religious life to any other interest you may have.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Realistic Policies – Policies at Duke are realistic. They address serious problems adequately, but allow college students to do what college students will inevitably do without unnecessarily harsh consequences. Campus police are prevalent but not feared.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics at Duke are truly unparalleled given the school's academic caliber. Though most of the unique aspects revolve around basketball (tenting, Cameron Crazies, Kville), athletics overall bring a fantastic sense of school spirit to the student body.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are a lot of people of different races at Duke, although they seem to self-segregate a bit.  I have never sensed any racial tension among students here.  Finally, there is a large Asian population!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
A Dichotomy of Standards Across Campuses – One of the great things about Duke is that it has an entire campus dedicated to Freshmen.  East Campus houses all undergraduate students during their first year and grants freshman space to become acclimated to the college lifestyle amongst themselves.  Everyone living on East is under 21 and the campus is strictly dry as a result.
In contrast West Campus, which is home to most juniors and sophomores, has a very loose drinking policy.  This dichotomy on alcohol policy creates a unique nightlife environment.  West campus is where all the parties are because, frankly, a freshman could pound a beer in front of a cop without repercussion. East's tighter regulation means that, even on a Saturday night, the space is relatively quiet.  I think it's great; as a freshman, I had a safe and fun place to drink and a quiet place to sleep and work.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Tough for Freshmen – Let's be honest, Duke is not famous for its smoking hot babes.  They do exist, but are few and far between.  Freshman year can be tough if you have high standards; upperclassmen will quickly identify and move in on the more attractive underclassmen women.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: AWESOME ATHLETIC PROGRAM – Duke won the NCAA championship this year in both lacrosse and basketball, and sports are a huge part of the Duke community. I spent five weeks in K-ville this past year in order to attend the Duke-Carolina game, and it was fantastic! The feeling of camaraderie with fellow Cameron Crazies is beyond anything I have ever experienced. Duke does a lot for its athletic programs and students are able to go to all varsity sports games without the hassle of buying tickets.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is more prevalent during the second semester when rush begins. Greek students are very much part of the school community, and their parties are usually open to all. It's also important to know that only the frats live together.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Breaking Stereotypes and Living up to Them – I'm not a big fan of greek life and have chosen to live in a Selective Living Group (SLG). Some frat guys seem to live up to the stereotypes of affluent misogynistic white bros. However, so many duke men completely break these stereotypes and surprise you when you find out what frat they're in. I'd say there's only a couple of frats that fall into the overall poor category, while the rest are important contributors to campus. Overall, Duke greek life dominates the social scene a bit too much, but at least it's interesting and diverse.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Generally Friendly and Accepting – Generally, the students are diverse and accepting, but I have heard about occurrences where this was not so.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Too Prevalent – Greek life is very big. While a majority of students do not participate in greek life, the majority of the social scene is run around Greek life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is diversity but there are also a lot of race specific groups. Black and Asian sororities and fraternities come to mind.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The People – Some of the people are wonderful.  But a lot of them seem to think a lot of themselves.  I don't interact with many of the undergrads, but working in a local restaurant I know that they can be a little stuck up and don't really tip very well.  The people in my program are great though, and really down to earth.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Cameron Crazies – Basketball is definitely a big deal at Duke and serves to really bring the campus together around times like the National Championship and the UNC game. Victorious bench-burning on the quad after such events is definitely a sight to see. Such a focus on one sport, though, can lead to a lacking in spirit for other ones, though lacrosse still tends to have a large contingent that follows it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Student Restrictions – Duke University staff understand that the vast majority of students there are responsible, hardworking students that are more concerned about their grades than anything. Thus, parties are not strictly enforced at it is rare that a university representative will intervene on a social activity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Some of the best academics that can be found. Most of the professors have such a genuine passion for what they teach. Don't get me wrong, it's extremely challenging. But, in the end, it's extremely worth it.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Duke academics are top notch.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: There are many great majors offered, and they each have fantastic faculty!
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: While pre-med students don't necessarily have an easy life, Duke helps you do the best you can. I like the different opportunities that I have while being pre med, like majoring in something completely unrelated. There are a lot of opportunities for what ever you may want - internships, research, shadowing, jobs, etc.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Any student can pursue any major, as long as he/she is enrolled in the correct college. Transferring from Pratt to Trinity or vice versa is fairly simple. While the major requirements themselves aren't bad, the Trinity requirements are pretty awful, considering the number of different types of courses you have to take to graduate.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Pre-med is hard. Normal students take four classes that meet twice a week (8 meetings per week in total) whereas pre=med students have labs, recitations/discussions, and lectures. I have 14 class meetings per week
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Duke is known for its academics. Everyone is very smart and they're expected to try their hardest.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The economics department at Duke is very strong. Great for landing internships.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: So many companies come to recruit at Duke. I've had an internship every summer since matriculating and the opportunities Duke provides is amazing.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Even the "easy" classes are hard. YOu'd also be hard pressed to find a professor who you didn't think was a genius. Even hated professors, professors who bore their students to tears, and professors who pick favorites and grade unfairly are unmatched when it comes it intellect, knowledge, about the subject, and experience in their fields. The curriculum and workload, of course, varies by class.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Professors - especially art history professors - are extremely great and very passionate. They are ready to help you whenever you need help, especially because of the small size of students taking this major. The school can benefit with a wider variety of courses. Workload is still doable and there is one program that is beneficial for my major. However, since my major is not popular, it is sometimes overlooked and thus, lack the number of resources.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Although Duke has passionate art history professor, I felt that it lack the wide range of variety of courses including contemporary art, 21st century modern art, etc. These are areas that I would like to develop more as a student and I would like to concentrate more on. Additionally, the school's location make it difficult for me to immerse myself in the art industry.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Engineering is hard, you're expected to just get it
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Truly outstanding. Professors expect a lot, but are extremely knowledgable about their topics. The competition is tough, making As hard to come by, so prepare to work very hard to receive grades you may not like. Popular majors include economics, biology, chemistry, biomedical engineering, public policy, and political science.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: There's a lot of pressure on campus to get amazing internships, especially in public service. I have held one internship in public service grant writing, allowing me to apply the research and writing skills learned through my major.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I enjoy my course of studies immensely, and feel that the academics at Duke have been outstanding. Most classes are small, allowing for a personal relationship with the professor, but the workload is very demanding. Expect about 200 pages of reading a week. Still, most humanities professors enjoy teaching, conversing with students, and helping them succeed. Even in a poor job market, nearly all students are able to find some job after college. History is not an easy major, and a true passion for the subject should be present before declaring.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I am in the nursing program.  They have wonderful professors and resources.  The curriculum is tough but doable and the facilities are exquisite.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I feel like anything you major in or pursue at duke is going to be really hard,
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: A lot of resources are given for you to do you best.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Challenging but manageable. You will learn as much as you want to
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: I am an Econ major with a concentration in Financial economics. It's a great program. It is one of the harder majors at Duke, and some of the core classes such as Econometrics can be a real beating. In my experience, the econ professors truly care about how you do and are very willing to meet outside of class. Additionally, the Financial education program run by Emma Rasiel is one of the best programs of its kind in the nation. Prof. Rasiel is beyond helpful and very willing to tell you how it is. If you are looking to go into finance, Rasiel is your best resource. She is extremely committed to the students and brings in an abundance of financial firms.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Duke is a target school for the majority of the big banks and consulting firms. As a result, these firms are on campus numerous times throughout the year for info sessions, then again for on-campus recruiting. The career center is very good at helping students secure internships.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Unbelievable School. So many opportunities and so much research being done. Honestly if you can afford this place, its worh your time.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Its not hard to get into. Do AP stats and make sure your calc skills are on point.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: one of the top rated for many years in the country for good reason
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: One of the top in the country and they really go above and beyond to make us the best professionals we can be
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The academics are top notch. The only problem is some professors see teaching as a chore and would rather focus on their research
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: You can't go wrong with Duke. Challenging.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The English program is awesome! The theatre program is fantastic too, but I sometimes wish there were more class options for theatrical design.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: My major in undergrad was public policy and international studies. And currently, I'm getting a teaching license from the same institution. But I will discuss my pubpol major. Public policy build a number of valuable skills in students such as memo writing and quants yet I found the major to be inflexible so that's why I also majored on international studies as the curriculum was more flexible and self designed. The facilities for the programs are top-notch.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Most of my professors were great. And there were many opportunities to engage in curricular and extracurricular opportunities.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: You declare a major.  Easy as that.  Figure they figure that is you can get into the school, you can hack it in the program.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Good variety of majors, but fewer specific majors.  You'll mostly find broader topics must suffice for specific goals (like Physical Therapy would need to be Biology).
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: English at Duke is great.  Good course variety with teachers who are experts in their fields and actually want to interact with their students.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Great curriculum with an interdisciplinary focus. Solid by and large but could definitely use a more robust theology component.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: It's Duke...it doesn't get much better than this.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Top finance, engineering, and consulting internships - they're competitive, but Duke students are always qualified.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Tons of great majors - would love to see a PPE - Philosophy, Politics, and Economics - but that probably won't happen. Otherwise, great range of majors.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: my program did a great job of keeping me informed and communicating with me
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Professors are nice and easy to approach
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The Divinity School is self-contained within the University so the professors are completely dedicated. The facilities are historical but top-notch.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: The curriculum is rigorous, the professors re dedicated and I know the education I'm getting is preparing me for future endeavors.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I have incredible access to my professors, the majority of whom are world renowned experts in their field of study.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Wonderful.  I was an Evolutionary Anthropology major (a lot of anatomy courses) and loved it.  The major was smaller and so courses allowed me to interact closely with professors and other students.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Once you make it to the small group courses the experience is wonderful.  The TAs are phenomenal and always willing to work with you & the professors clearly love the material they are teaching.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: The instructors are very professional, but some of them have been in the industry for too long. many of them like to talk about personal issues or try to be your friend more than your instructor.this is disappointing because I paid a lot of money for this school to make me become a professional. If you keep your head down and ignore the bull s*** and get the most you can out of your classes then you may have a very successful career in the automotive industry . this school may be frustrating but its better to stick it out than drop out or go crazy.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: When I applied to Duke I was accepted in the Trinity College of Arts and Sciences, but sophomore year I transferred into the Pratt School of Engineering.  At Duke you have to wait until the end of your freshman year at least to transfer schools but you can still take classes in either school, so it was easy to get on track for transferring into Pratt and the procedure to do so was to fill out a simple application, so figuring out what I wanted to study was fairly easy and there were no difficulties during the process of getting into my program.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Known for it's medical school and healthcare majors it's a great school for me in Nursing.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I'm a mechanical Engineer. The workload is hard, but I'm going to be especially competitive coming out of Duke. The faculty's very helpful. I still have faculty members from previous classes emailing me asking about how I'm doing.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The academics at Duke are some of the best in the country. We are known for the cream of the crop students. The school is getting even more competitive with the new classes.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Great options and choices for anyone. You can mix and match majors, minors, and certificate programs. Additionally, there are many study abroad opportunities for all sorts of majors.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I am in the nursing program, FNP program.  I have enjoyed everything about my program from the professors to other students.  They help you every step of the way.  For example, I plan to go to St. Vincent to study abroad and they are setting it all up for me.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: As I've already discussed in some other question. BME at Duke is an awesome major and the curriculum is among the best, but there is so much that can be done to improve teaching of students if professors weren't such hardcore researchers with no time on their hands or the patience to teach basics to young guns.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Everything is great. I love the college and everything, but the BME program specifically has a lot to improve in terms of its student-professor interactions. Duke is a BME research powerhouse. So much so that professors assume students know loads of material without them actually teaching it to us. Whatever. I'm keeping up as best as I can.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I'm in the MHS-PA program here and I couldn't be happier with my choice.  The faculty is so encouraging and really wants us to succeed.  I love the emphasis that they place not only on learning the material, but becoming a professional who focuses on sincerely caring about their patients well being.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Duke is a very intense school. There is always a decent amount of work, but if you manage your time correctly, it won't be too bad. The instructors are extremely smart and accomplished, but sometimes they aren't that great of instructors, so make sure to check on the student reviews before deciding which courses to take. Also, make sure to have good relations with all of your instructors and advisers as they could possibly get you an internship or a job if you know them well enough.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Classes are difficult and you will work really hard, but I don't think you could get a better education anywhere. There are abundant resources for all classes -- office hours, TA help-rooms, peer tutors, etc -- and the administration really focuses on the undergraduates. Disciplines heavy in quantitative sciences and analysis (engineering, math, physics, chem, econ) require a ton of time on problem sets, while language, history, poli sci, and English classes require lots of reading. Prepare to spend a lot of time in the library!
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Little Bit of Everything – You can find just about any classes you are interested in. Most of the professors are fantastic, but it helps to actually check CourseRank and Rate My Professor. If you work really hard on research, you can have a great schedule geared towards what you do best (tests, papers, quizzes).
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Top Tier School – Professors are very helpful and full of knowledge. Great rigor.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I started as a Biomedical Engineer major, but decided to change my major to Statistical Science after my freshman year. I love that Statistics allows me to combine my strengths (math, programming, analytical skills, etc) while also letting me decide whether or not to avoid my weaknesses (organic chemistry, biology, etc.) I am excited that statisticians are needed in so many diverse fields and that job stability is almost guaranteed.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Small Department – The Statistical Science department at Duke is relatively small. This is a perk in that it means smaller class sizes as compared to Engineering or Chemistry lectures. It also allows students to get to know their professors more intimately and helps encourage participant learning. However, it also means that for students looking for research opportunities, there is only a limited scope which the STA professors are able to cover. Not to worry; there are several other programs across campus that like to have Statistics students involved in their research, such as Math, Bio, CompSci, Econ, PubPol, etc.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Duke has a wide variety of classes in so many departments, all with extremely knowledgable professors. Of course, introductory classes are not the best, but once you get to higher level classes, there is a lot of interaction with professors with smaller class size, and they are extremely helpful.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: So Many Great Classes to Chose from – There are so many classes that are great that it is really hard to chose the ones you are going to take for your degree. It makes you want to overload your schedule or go another year just to fit them all in. The professors are great too and there is some great hands on experience in the classes not just all theory.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: So Far So Good – I don't start school until August but everyone I have contacted has been helpful and friendly. They are good at answering questions and helping out when there is a problem.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Like any school, you will find the occasional oddball or bad professor, but on the whole Duke is full of fantastic faculty that invest in their students. Admittedly, intro classes are often a pain (large, hard). Still, there are so many opportunities and fascinating people at Duke. Sometimes the work load can feel overwhelming, but you just get through it and there are generally resources to support you along the way.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Duke is tough, especially if you choose a major that has a reputation for being tough. But the hard work pays off, since it is a very-well regarded institution, and all the rigor prepares you for anything. Duke also has an extensive alumni network, and a very helpful career office. That being said, choice of major matters a lot in career prospects. Choose wisely - if it's a hard major there's a reason everyone's going for it (no, it's always intellectual curiosity).
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Opportunities Galore – Small class sizes and huge emphasis on professor student relations leads to amazing interactions and intellectual engagement. Great outside speakers really supplements in class lessons as well! I have a great first year internship because of specific skills I learned in my major's classes.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: there are a miriad of majors that are good for all people.
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: It Is Good – the internships are good and even easier if you do well.
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: The academics at Duke speak for themselves.  Duke is one of the highest research universities in the country.  This had its downside though.  Some professors are more interested in their research than their classes, and the administration tends to value professors who research more than those who strictly teach.  The work is hard in most classes, and you need to know how to manage a heavy workload, but almost everone does.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Hard, Fun, Challenging – There are a mix of professors who are great and fair and fun to learn from and some that are not- this is typical of any college. The classes are generally challenging and not boring. With the close affiliation of the medical school there are more opportunities for grad level academics (i.e. Human Anatomy with a human cadaver lab). There are tremendous opportunities for research that could lead to an authorship on a paper. Very helpful to student athletes.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Phenomenal Professors – I have had some great professors in my graduate program.  I have learned quite a bit and have enjoyed in depth discussions on topics I am passionate about.  Overall great classes and my graduate major suits me well.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Popular Majors – Pre-med, BME, economics. Competitive but not cut throat; great working environment.  Study groups and tutors are readily available, and office hours are offered by the majority of, if not all, professors.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Amazing Professors – At Duke University I have had some of the most amazing professors - professors who can take your mind on a journey so that when it's time to pack up, you almost forgot you were in a classroom. Such an amazing experience learning here. Only complaint I have is that the site used for course registration can be non-user friendly. Workload is high but that's part of why it is such a respected school - you will learn to work hard!!
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Public Policy – The work load is intense. You may have been top of your class in college, but you won't be here. Do not come to this college just because your family wants you to go to a top ten school. You will end up really unhappy.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: English Major – Being an English Major at Duke University has to be one of the greatest experiences during my Duke Career. The faculty are reknowned, very approachable and available. The course material we cover allows for critical thinking, engagement with the material and awesome class discussions. I never intended to be an English major, but the department's classes were always the most interesting and fulfilling courses. Without a doubt, I love being an English major.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Work Hard, Play Hard – Many students come to Duke University with basketball in mind, but they realize they have to balance their priorities if they want to stay enrolled. The unofficial motto at Duke is "work hard, play hard." Students are extremely devoted to their studies during the week, but know how to unwind after a particularly grueling exam. This rare balance makes Duke a unique and enjoyable university to attend.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Biology Major – It's very difficult being a biology major at Duke. Because many students who choose this major are pre- med with the intention of going to medical school, many of the courses are run accordingly. I feel that they try to weed out students who may think they want to go into the medical field, but are not equipped to deal with the necessary future schooling. I think that those of us who are biology majors but do not intend to go into the medical field are put into classes that are unnecessarily difficult.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Very Dedicated – Duke is very dedicated to helping you get the most out of a college educations and the resources available to students are amazing! The biology program is definitely one of the best that I've seen and the professors that you work with truly love what they're doing
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The Economics department at Duke is an extremely rigorous curriculum. There are multiple mathematics and statistics courses required in order to complete the major itself. A lot of the lower level courses are made as "weed-out" classes and give extremely difficult exams to dilute the amount of students in the major. Very tough to obtain A's in classes unless you put in tons of hours per week.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Women's Studies – The Women's Studies program is extremely interesting and provacative-- not easy courses, but always interesting and cutting edge. I would never consider myself a "feminist" but am considering a WS minor because I loved the classes so much.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review:
Duke has world class faculty.  They expect you to be responsible for your work-- you are no longer in high school-- yet they are all very responsive to questions; they want you to succeed. That is not to say that there are some more 'lack luster' professors out there who don't fit that mold.

 If you are interested in Public Policy, Engineering, Economics or Medicine, Duke has extremely strong programs. Then again, I personally lean towards the humanities and social sciences and am still very content with the offerings.  

The workload differs from person to person, however the general consensus is that being a Duke student means having to do work (especially if you are an engineer or pre-med). Then again, if you got into Duke, you can probably handle it.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Lots of people want to be econ majors, so it's a big department.  They know how to get you ready for whatever career/grad school path you want to take.  However, I've also heard that it's a big department with big classes so not always ideal, especially since smaller classes where you get to know your professors really well do exist at Duke. I haven't loved my intro classes so far, but I heard no one really likes the intro classes that much anyway.  I'm excited about the electives, however.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Generally Great – Generally, there are great professors who are happy to interact with students one-on-one and help. There are some departments which could have a wider selection of courses. The workload is tough, as expected, but manageable.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Great help from the Econ advisors, renowned faculty, and amazing alumni placement!
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Tough - Worthy of Reputation – There are a few people who seem to do little to no work but they won't last long. I spend at least 4 hours a day in the library (school nights) but I still have time to go out if I want to on weekends. The Professors know Duke's rep and want to keep it up so most of them will bust your butt. There are so many special programs that are cool and interesting. I just heard about one where you take a gateway course then you are given options of various women's groups to intern with in NYC for a summer.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Current construction notwithstanding, the campus is stunning. Several close friends selected this university over others simply because of its aesthetic appeal. Especially among this century's additions, new structures are painstakingly tailored to complement Duke's stylistic character (Neo-Gothic on West, Collegiate Georgian on East). Athletic facilities are worthy of the Blue Devils' distinguished reputations, and the library system ranks among the country's most comprehensive. Undergraduates assume ownership of student programming campaigns, a logical but unusual allowance that dates to the 1950s. It is not uncommon for student leaders to directly oversee 5- to 6-figure programming budgets.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Campus is beautiful - BUT THERE IS SO MUCH CONSTRUCTION RIGHT NOW. The main dining hall, the chapel, Wallace Wade, the Bryan Center, the plaza are all under construction or about to be under construction, which makes it a little limited. Cranes abound.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Durham isn't exactly known for its Town-Gown relations, but that's largely the students' fault in my opinion.  Students who do go out into the community, either as consumers or for service, often find that it's a very enriching part of their Duke experience.  Durham has such an interesting history that I find going to school here a big plus. The Triangle is a fabulous pocket of liberal intellectuals. I could see myself living in Durham for the rest of my life.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Not much to do, but there is always DPAC which has events and some festivals, plus a lot of good restaurants. Can feel somewhat unsafe at times though.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The campus is gorgeous and has lots of fun places to hang out, but the quality has been severely diminished as of late with all of the construction on campus. I feel like the construction is really negatively impacting my experience at Duke.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: There is a great community but many students do not take advantage of it
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Decent locally. It's a small town so you can't expect too much.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Durham and Duke have made a concerted effort to bridge the gulf between their respective communities. A city-wide transportation system is available to all students, and it stops at all of the city's major attractions. The American Tobacco Campus, Durham Performing Arts Center (DPAC), Durham Art Guild, historic Carolina Theatre, and numerous other attractions have transformed downtown Durham a vibrant destination that rivals Raleigh's cultural appeal and Chapel Hill's college town charm. DPAC, for example, now hosts all of the touring Broadway shows and many of the major concert acts that visit the Triangle region. Disregard the literature Duke publishes about not needing a car on campus: as much as I admire and respect environmental efforts, my car is often the only means of transportation between the university and anything beyond Durham proper, such as the city's swanky Southpoint Mall complex.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Durham is a great college town, and Raleigh is very close as well.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: North Carolina weather is great. It only gets really hot in August, but for the rest of the year, it's often sunny with good temperatures.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The school is gorgeous. Great athletic facilities and the library is pretty nice. The student center is probably one of the ugliest buildings on campus though.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Duke has so many busses running between all three campuses and to certain locations around the hospital and off-campus. Sometimes, like for Fall and Spring break, they'll offer a shuttle to RDU (the airport).
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: If you live off-campus, parking in Blue Zone is a nightmare. I hope they change it one day.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Getting out into Durham can be difficult, but getting around campus is always fairly easy. Public transportation can be a little sketchy at times, but fairly easy to track/catch if you're really keen on getting somewhere.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: When it rains, it pours at Duke. Girls, bring your rainboots. Boys, I wish it were more socially acceptable for you all to have rainboots, because it's often the only way I survive rainy days without getting completely soaked. Summers are a little hard at night when you lack air conditioning, but otherwise walking to class is bearable if a little uncomfortable. Snow, when it happens, isn't too inconvenient. Usually roads, parking lots, paths, and walkways are cleared quickly and facilitate a beautiful walk to and from class/etc.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Freshman dorms and I think a few others still lack AC, but all the Duke facilities otherwise (classrooms, buildings, gyms, etc.) are beautiful and if not, at least very functional (West Duke at the moment, excluded).
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: They have really good facilities: state of the art gyms, libraries filled with numerous resources, lots of green spaces (you are literally surrounded by a forest).
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: So far so good. However in February, the weather had been slightly bipolar. It might be snowing on Monday and be extremely hot by Sunday, so make sure you bring coats and shorts.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: As a freshman, I am only allowed to park on smith gated warehouse, which is not even on East Campus (The freshman living section at Duke). Parking become extremely difficult when I have to park at West as the parking area in Bryan Centre gets filled up rather quickly. I ended up having to pay extra to have my car parked in the parking lot. If you want to get it for free, do it after 5 pm (there are usually some open spots in front of the chapel).
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The computer system at my school is really well, with wireless readily available at every spots on campus. There are OIT labs in both of the major libraries - Lilly and Perkins - that could assist students with computer softwares from Photoshop, etc.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Hostility between Duke students and locals
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Durham is an up and coming city. You just have to know where to look.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Usually the weather is amazing. Just buy a raincoat and Hunter boots.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: You basically need your own computer. I haven't met a single person without one.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Haven't had any issues with it so far
Campus.Author: College Freshman
